author: Haroon Habib
text:
The new Indian High Commissioner to Bangladesh, Harsh Bardhan Shringla, on Thursday said that he would work for taking bilateral relations to “new depths and heights”.

Mr.Shringla, who arrived in Dhaka on Thursday, said that he would focus on implementing the decisions agreed upon by the leaderships of the two countries.

His mandate, he said, was to “deepen and strengthen India’s relations with Bangladesh”.

Asked about his priority, Mr.Shringla said the leaders of the two countries had taken many “very intensive and flourishing decisions” that needed to be “implemented as soon as possible”.

The career diplomat has held a number of positions in New Delhi and in Indian missions in Paris, Hanoi and Tel Aviv in his over 30 years of career.

Prior to his appointment in Dhaka, he had been serving as the Ambassador to Thailand.

Earlier, at a farewell meeting with Bangladesh Ambassador in Bangkok, Saida Muna Tasneem, Mr. Shringla expressed his resolve to take India’s multifaceted bilateral relations with its close neighbour to “new depths and heights”.

Challenges

Mr. Shringla, who succeeds Pankaj Saran, will take up the new assignment at a time when the decades-old land boundary issue has been settled while new avenues of cooperation have been created.

But the dispute over sharing Teesta water still remains unresolved.

His predecessor, Mr. Saran, who has served in Bangladesh since 2012, was credited with efforts to secure the land boundary agreement.

Mr. Saran also oversaw a host of high-profile visits to Dhaka from India and played a key role in promoting crucial accords, during both the Congress and BJP regimes.
title: New envoy to Bangladesh to focus on agreed pacts
